headline: Trump’s New Steel Tariffs Look Vulnerable to a Courtroom Challenge
summary: The steel tariffs, like those on autos and auto parts, are sector-based.  The U.S. Court of International Trade in May blocked Trump’s tariffs on U.S. trading partners, rejecting the argument that he could invoke emergency powers to set the country-by-country tariffs.  An appeals court stayed that ruling, pending its own review.

headline: Tariff Tailwinds Vs. Political Headwinds: Commercial Metals Remains A Hold For Now
summary: CMC benefits from infrastructure tailwinds and efficiency gains, but macroeconomic and tariff uncertainties warrant caution before investing.
